citation.article-title: Characterization of a Rothia-like organism from a mouse: description of Rothia nasimurium sp. nov. and reclassification of Stomatococcus mucilaginosus as Rothia mucilaginosa comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rothia nasimurium sp. nov.
Rothia nasimurium (na.si.mu'ri.um. M.L. pl. gen. n. nasimurium of the nose of mice)
Produce a weak α-haemolysis on blood agar.
Acid is produced from glucose, lactose, maltose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, sucrose and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from L-arabinose, D-arabitol, cyclodextrin, glycogen, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, N-acetylglucosamine, pullulan, raffinose, ribose, sorbitol, tagatose or D-xylose.
Alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, ester lipase C-8, bgalacturonidase, α-glucosidase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, pyrazinamidase and trypsin are produced.

Alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, esterase C-4, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, lipase C14, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, pyrrolydonyl arylamidase and urease are not produced.
Acid phosphatase, chymotrypsin, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, β-galactosidase, glycine tryptophan arylamidase may or may not be produced.
Aesculin is hydrolysed but not hippurate.
Cellular fatty acids are mainly of the methyl-branched types with ai-C15 predominating.
Isolated from the nose of a healthy mouse.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 56 mol%.
